comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Great color picture of two ERA-3B Skywarrior One peeling off away from camera. Both of VAQ-33 tail code GD. Nearest is ERA-3B Bu No 144827, Modex 101. Wing pylons with jamming pods Forward fuselage ram air electrical generator turbines on stubs. Extended rear fuselages. Underfuselage panniers for electronics. Some notes on ERA-3B Bu No 144827; Originally built as A3D-2P Accepted by US Navy June 1959 Became RA-3B from 1962 Converted by NARF Alameda to ERA-3B in June 1973 and assigned to VAQ-33. Lost after mid-air collision with KA-3B 138925 enroute to Elmendorf AFB. Wreckage recovered, 2 fatalities. 16 Nov 1987. This comprehensive website records the incident: www.a3skywarrior.com/memorial/full_accident_date.htm VAQ 33. 144827. 11/16/1987 (16 Nov 1987) Not stated; over water. (Possibly Elmendorf Alaska) Midair collision with KA-3B BuNo 138925 during formation flight. Pilot; Lt John Whiteley……………A Nav; Lt Jerry Frazier………………D Ecomo; Lt Willie Scott……………A Crew Chief; AMS2 Craig Valois...D Report on the other aircraft involved; VAQ 33 138925. 11/16/1987. Midair collision with ERA-3B BuNo 144827 during formation flight. 138925 recovered after losing one engine. Landed safely. My respect to both crews, their families or friends. 1966 picture of RA-3B 144827: www.abpic.co.uk/photo/1098024/ At RAF Weathersfield open day, England, UK. 11 June 1966. 1973 picture of ERA-3B 144827: a3skywarrior.com/index.php?nid=100236&s=gl&media_... ERA-3B (144827) of VAQ-33 This was taken on a local hop out of Norfolk, Va. on Aug. 29, 1973. Harry took this from an EA-4F Skyhawk (152852) with his usual eye for an excellant shot. Photo contributed by Tom Yount Photo taken by Harry S. Gann 1978 picture of ERA-3B 144827: www.airliners.net/photo/USA---Navy/Douglas-ERA-3B-Skywarr... Keflavik : Iceland, September 7, 1978 ERA-3B 144827 may also be viewed here on ‘flickr’: www.flickr.com/photos/8416077@N08/4362352752/ Goose Bay, Labrador, Canada , September 7, 1978 An attached comment also has details and links. A French enthusiast site, scroll down for a large picture of ERA-3B 144827 with VAQ-33: flyfan.hostonet.org/viewtopic.php?p=44476 As the serial number for the other ERA-3B cannot be read, it will have been one of only seven others; 142668 144832 144838 144841 144846 146446 146447 Go to this web page for info on RA-3B/ ERA-3B Skywarrior: www.joebaugher.com/usattack/newa3_5.html My thanks to Professor Joe Baugher, Chicago, Illinois
